description: Erection of part three and part four storey development comprising of eight 4-bedroom townhouses together with 10 parking spaces; storage for 34 cycles; refuse storage and associated landscaping.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  The development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the occupation of the first dwelling full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | Prior to the occupation of the first dwelling a schedule of landscape maintenance for a minimum period of 5 years from the implementation of final planting  has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Landscape maintenance shall be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule.  REASON: To protect the landscaping in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | No development shall take place on site until such time as the details of any services, excavations or any other works to be undertaken within the crown spread and vicinity of the trees to be retained on and adjacent to the site shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and the necessary works shall be undertaken in accordance with the agreed detail.  REASON: To provide sufficient protection for the trees to be retained in the interests of the visual amenity of the locality and in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines' | No development shall take place until such time as a tree report and survey to BS5837 2005 standard has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority as well as method statement for demolitiion and construction within tree protection zones. Details of the works necessary to protect the trees to be retained within and adjacent to the site shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development and the approved details shall be implemented prior to commencement of the development and retained until it is completed.  No materials, plant, other equipment, storage or other works shall take place at any time within the enclosed area around the trees to be retained.   REASON: To provide sufficient protection for the trees to be retained in the interests of the visual amenity of the locality and in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | Prior to the occupation of the first dwelling a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment (including any internal fences, walls and railings to the balconies) to be erected, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The boundary treatment shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and completed prior to the occupation of the units and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of the prospective residents and neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The cycle parking shown on the approved plan reference 140/09/PL/100 Rev A, shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To provide and retain adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy  9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The car parking spaces and associated access areas shown on the approved plans 140/09/PL100 Rev A dated 25th February 2010 and 140/09/Pl/100 Rev B dated 21st April 2010, shall be constructed and  marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking, and shall not be used for any other purpose.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | Details of measures for protecting the building envelope (roof, walls and windows) of the residential units from external noise,and  vibration including aircraft noise and internal separation between the ground floor refuse storage area and the residential units, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The works shall be carried out as approved before first occupation and shall thereafter be retained.  REASON: To protect the amenities  and the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential units, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration' | All the houses hereby approved  be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed by the local planning authority.    REASON: To ensure access for all future occupiers in accordance with policy 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | Notwithstanding any details as shown on the approved plans no balconies or terraces shall be created on the North elevation of the residential units.  REASON: To prevent overlooking of neighbouring properties and to accord with Policy 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A,.B,C, D, E, F, G, H,  of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment )(No.2) (England) Order 2008,  no extensions or alterations shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON:	To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building to accord with Policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) . | The refuse storage shall be constructed and be available for use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently.  REASON:	To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | Unless otherwise agreed in writing with the local planning authority lockable bollards shall be constructed at entrance to each parking bays before the occupation of the development hereby approved  and permananetly maintained.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking, in accordance with policies  9.1 and 9.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'.
site_number: Land at rear of 32-38 Westel House
